fixedFields.name: swagger
fixedFields.description: Required. Specifies the Swagger Specification version being used. It can be used by the Swagger UI and other clients to interpret the API listing. The value MUST be "2.0".

fixedFields.name: info
fixedFields.description: Required. Provides metadata about the API. The metadata can be used by the clients if needed.

fixedFields.name: host
fixedFields.description: The host (name or ip) serving the API. This MUST be the host only and does not include the scheme nor sub-paths. It MAY include a port. If the host is not included, the host serving the documentation is to be used (including the port). The host does not support path templating.

fixedFields.name: basePath
fixedFields.description: The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the host. If it is not included, the API is served directly under the host. The value MUST start with a leading slash (/). The basePath does not support path templating.

fixedFields.name: schemes
fixedFields.description: The transfer protocol of the API. Values MUST be from the list: "http", "https", "ws", "wss". If the schemes is not included, the default scheme to be used is the one used to access the Swagger definition itself.

fixedFields.name: consumes
fixedFields.description: A list of MIME types the APIs can consume. This is global to all APIs but can be overridden on specific API calls. Value MUST be as described under Mime Types.

fixedFields.name: produces
fixedFields.description: A list of MIME types the APIs can produce. This is global to all APIs but can be overridden on specific API calls. Value MUST be as described under Mime Types.

fixedFields.name: paths
fixedFields.description: Required. The available paths and operations for the API.

fixedFields.name: definitions
fixedFields.description: An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations. This property does not define global parameters for all operations.

fixedFields.name: responses
fixedFields.description: An object to hold responses that can be used across operations. This property does not define global responses for all operations.

fixedFields.name: securityDefinitions
fixedFields.description: Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.

fixedFields.name: security
fixedFields.description: A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole. The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements). Individual operations can override this definition.

fixedFields.name: tags
fixedFields.description: A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata. The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools. Not all tags that are used by the Operation Object must be declared. The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic. Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation.

fixedFields.name: title
fixedFields.description: Required. The title of the application.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A short description of the application. GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: termsOfService
fixedFields.description: The Terms of Service for the API.

fixedFields.name: contact
fixedFields.description: The contact information for the exposed API.

fixedFields.name: license
fixedFields.description: The license information for the exposed API.

fixedFields.name: version
fixedFields.description: Required Provides the version of the application API (not to be confused with the specification version).

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. MUST be in the format of a URL.

fixedFields.name: email
fixedFields.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. MUST be in the format of an email address.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Required. The license name used for the API.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: A URL to the license used for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.

fixedFields.name: $ref
fixedFields.description: Allows for an external definition of this path item. The referenced structure MUST be in the format of a Path Item Object. If there are conflicts between the referenced definition and this Path Item's definition, the behavior is undefined.

fixedFields.name: get
fixedFields.description: A definition of a GET operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: put
fixedFields.description: A definition of a PUT operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: post
fixedFields.description: A definition of a POST operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: delete
fixedFields.description: A definition of a DELETE operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: options
fixedFields.description: A definition of a OPTIONS operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: head
fixedFields.description: A definition of a HEAD operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: patch
fixedFields.description: A definition of a PATCH operation on this path.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for all the operations described under this path. These parameters can be overridden at the operation level, but cannot be removed there. The list MUST NOT include duplicated parameters. A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location. The list can use the Reference Object to link to parameters that are defined at the Swagger Object's parameters. There can be one "body" parameter at most.

fixedFields.name: tags
fixedFields.description: A list of tags for API documentation control. Tags can be used for logical grouping of operations by resources or any other qualifier.

fixedFields.name: summary
fixedFields.description: A short summary of what the operation does. For maximum readability in the swagger-ui, this field SHOULD be less than 120 characters.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A verbose explanation of the operation behavior. GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this operation.

fixedFields.name: operationId
fixedFields.description: Unique string used to identify the operation. The id MUST be unique among all operations described in the API. Tools and libraries MAY use the operationId to uniquely identify an operation, therefore, it is recommended to follow common programming naming conventions.

fixedFields.name: consumes
fixedFields.description: A list of MIME types the operation can consume. This overrides the consumes definition at the Swagger Object. An empty value MAY be used to clear the global definition. Value MUST be as described under Mime Types.

fixedFields.name: produces
fixedFields.description: A list of MIME types the operation can produce. This overrides the produces definition at the Swagger Object. An empty value MAY be used to clear the global definition. Value MUST be as described under Mime Types.

fixedFields.name: parameters
fixedFields.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for this operation. If a parameter is already defined at the Path Item, the new definition will override it, but can never remove it. The list MUST NOT include duplicated parameters. A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location. The list can use the Reference Object to link to parameters that are defined at the Swagger Object's parameters. There can be one "body" parameter at most.

fixedFields.name: responses
fixedFields.description: Required. The list of possible responses as they are returned from executing this operation.

fixedFields.name: schemes
fixedFields.description: The transfer protocol for the operation. Values MUST be from the list: "http", "https", "ws", "wss". The value overrides the Swagger Object schemes definition.

fixedFields.name: deprecated
fixedFields.description: Declares this operation to be deprecated. Usage of the declared operation should be refrained. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: security
fixedFields.description: A declaration of which security schemes are applied for this operation. The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements). This definition overrides any declared top-level security. To remove a top-level security declaration, an empty array can be used.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A short description of the target documentation. GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: url
fixedFields.description: Required. The URL for the target documentation. Value MUST be in the format of a URL.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Required. The name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive. If in is "path", the name field MUST correspond to the associated path segment from the path field in the Paths Object. See Path Templating for further information.For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name used based on the in property.

fixedFields.name: in
fixedFields.description: Required. The location of the parameter. Possible values are "query", "header", "path", "formData" or "body".

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: required
fixedFields.description: Determines whether this parameter is mandatory. If the parameter is in "path", this property is required and its value MUST be true. Otherwise, the property MAY be included and its default value is false.

fixedFields.name: schema
fixedFields.description: Required. The schema defining the type used for the body parameter.

fixedFields.name: type
fixedFields.description: Required. The type of the parameter. Since the parameter is not located at the request body, it is limited to simple types (that is, not an object). The value MUST be one of "string", "number", "integer", "boolean", "array" or "file". If type is "file", the consumes MUST be either "multipart/form-data", " application/x-www-form-urlencoded" or both and the parameter MUST be in "formData".

fixedFields.name: format
fixedFields.description: The extending format for the previously mentioned type. See Data Type Formats for further details.

fixedFields.name: allowEmptyValue
fixedFields.description: Sets the ability to pass empty-valued parameters. This is valid only for either query or formData parameters and allows you to send a parameter with a name only or  an empty value. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: items
fixedFields.description: Required if type is "array". Describes the type of items in the array.

fixedFields.name: collectionFormat
fixedFields.description: Determines the format of the array if type array is used. Possible values are: csv - comma separated values foo,bar. ssv - space separated values foo bar. tsv - tab separated values foo\tbar. pipes - pipe separated values foo|bar. multi - corresponds to multiple parameter instances instead of multiple values for a single instance foo=bar&foo=baz. This is valid only for parameters in "query" or "formData".  Default value is csv.

fixedFields.name: default
fixedFields.description: Declares the value of the parameter that the server will use if none is provided, for example a "count" to control the number of results per page might default to 100 if not supplied by the client in the request. (Note: "default" has no meaning for required parameters.)  See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2. Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined type for this parameter.

fixedFields.name: maximum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.2.

fixedFields.name: exclusiveMaximum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.2.

fixedFields.name: minimum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.3.

fixedFields.name: exclusiveMinimum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.3.

fixedFields.name: maxLength
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.1.

fixedFields.name: minLength
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.2.

fixedFields.name: pattern
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.3.

fixedFields.name: maxItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.2.

fixedFields.name: minItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.3.

fixedFields.name: uniqueItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.4.

fixedFields.name: enum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.5.1.

fixedFields.name: multipleOf
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.1.

fixedFields.name: type
fixedFields.description: Required. The internal type of the array. The value MUST be one of "string", "number", "integer", "boolean", or "array". Files and models are not allowed.

fixedFields.name: format
fixedFields.description: The extending format for the previously mentioned type. See Data Type Formats for further details.

fixedFields.name: items
fixedFields.description: Required if type is "array". Describes the type of items in the array.

fixedFields.name: collectionFormat
fixedFields.description: Determines the format of the array if type array is used. Possible values are: csv - comma separated values foo,bar. ssv - space separated values foo bar. tsv - tab separated values foo\tbar. pipes - pipe separated values foo|bar.  Default value is csv.

fixedFields.name: default
fixedFields.description: Declares the value of the item that the server will use if none is provided. (Note: "default" has no meaning for required items.) See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2. Unlike JSON Schema this value MUST conform to the defined type for the data type.

fixedFields.name: maximum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.2.

fixedFields.name: exclusiveMaximum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.2.

fixedFields.name: minimum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.3.

fixedFields.name: exclusiveMinimum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.3.

fixedFields.name: maxLength
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.1.

fixedFields.name: minLength
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.2.

fixedFields.name: pattern
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.2.3.

fixedFields.name: maxItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.2.

fixedFields.name: minItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.3.

fixedFields.name: uniqueItems
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.3.4.

fixedFields.name: enum
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.5.1.

fixedFields.name: multipleOf
fixedFields.description: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-5.1.1.

fixedFields.name: default
fixedFields.description: The documentation of responses other than the ones declared for specific HTTP response codes. It can be used to cover undeclared responses. Reference Object can be used to link to a response that is defined at the Swagger Object's responses section.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: Required. A short description of the response. GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: schema
fixedFields.description: A definition of the response structure. It can be a primitive, an array or an object. If this field does not exist, it means no content is returned as part of the response. As an extension to the Schema Object, its root type value may also be "file". This SHOULD be accompanied by a relevant produces mime-type.

fixedFields.name: headers
fixedFields.description: A list of headers that are sent with the response.

fixedFields.name: examples
fixedFields.description: An example of the response message.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Required. The name of the tag.

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A short description for the tag. GFM syntax can be used for rich text representation.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this tag.

fixedFields.name: $ref
fixedFields.description: Required. The reference string.

fixedFields.name: discriminator
fixedFields.description: Adds support for polymorphism. The discriminator is the schema property name that is used to differentiate between other schema that inherit this schema. The property name used MUST be defined at this schema and it MUST be in the required property list. When used, the value MUST be the name of this schema or any schema that inherits it.

fixedFields.name: readOnly
fixedFields.description: Relevant only for Schema "properties" definitions. Declares the property as "read only". This means that it MAY be sent as part of a response but MUST NOT be sent as part of the request. Properties marked as readOnly being true SHOULD NOT be in the required list of the defined schema. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: xml
fixedFields.description: This MAY be used only on properties schemas. It has no effect on root schemas. Adds Additional metadata to describe the XML representation format of this property.

fixedFields.name: externalDocs
fixedFields.description: Additional external documentation for this schema.

fixedFields.name: example
fixedFields.description: A free-form property to include an example of an instance for this schema.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Replaces the name of the element/attribute used for the described schema property. When defined within the Items Object (items), it will affect the name of the individual XML elements within the list. When defined alongside type being array (outside the items), it will affect the wrapping element and only if wrapped is true. If wrapped is false, it will be ignored.

fixedFields.name: namespace
fixedFields.description: The URL of the namespace definition. Value SHOULD be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: prefix
fixedFields.description: The prefix to be used for the name.

fixedFields.name: attribute
fixedFields.description: Declares whether the property definition translates to an attribute instead of an element. Default value is false.

fixedFields.name: wrapped
fixedFields.description: MAY be used only for an array definition. Signifies whether the array is wrapped (for example, <books><book/><book/></books>) or unwrapped (<book/><book/>). Default value is false. The definition takes effect only when defined alongside type being array (outside the items).

fixedFields.name: type
fixedFields.description: Required. The type of the security scheme. Valid values are "basic", "apiKey" or "oauth2".

fixedFields.name: description
fixedFields.description: A short description for security scheme.

fixedFields.name: name
fixedFields.description: Required. The name of the header or query parameter to be used.

fixedFields.name: in
fixedFields.description: Required The location of the API key. Valid values are "query" or "header".

fixedFields.name: flow
fixedFields.description: Required. The flow used by the OAuth2 security scheme. Valid values are "implicit", "password", "application" or "accessCode".

fixedFields.name: authorizationUrl
fixedFields.description: Required. The authorization URL to be used for this flow. This SHOULD be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: tokenUrl
fixedFields.description: Required. The token URL to be used for this flow. This SHOULD be in the form of a URL.

fixedFields.name: scopes
fixedFields.description: Required. The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme.
